> 
> Uhm... I have this little theory. And I hope... SO MUCH that this is the case. 
> Rbray, the creator of EVE went missing all of sudden right around the time it was announced KSP was going to 1.0.
> 
> So, what are the chances Squad secretly pulled Rbray aside and to incorporate clouds for 1.0?
> 
> How freaking cool would that be?

God that would be perfect. However, they've always announced that modders were going to contribute their work well before the next release, that hasn't happened here. I hope you're right, I just don't know though.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-08T16:16:35Z" title="04/08/2015 04:16  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 8, 2015</time> by DunaRocketeer**

> 
> - Also, it's always daytime in the VAB and SPH! I know it may be a little more difficult to realistically simulate lighting throughout the day and into the night, but it would add a nice touch.

I hink it makes more sense that way, why in the world would you be doing that stuff at night. The most you'd do would be a nighttime rollout.

> 
> Uhm... I have this little theory. And I hope... SO MUCH that this is the case. 
> Rbray, the creator of EVE went missing all of sudden right around the time it was announced KSP was going to 1.0. ( might've been sometime before then )
> 
> So, what are the chances Squad secretly pulled Rbray aside to incorporate clouds for 1.0?
> 
> How freaking cool would that be?

An interesting hypothesis. Considering they have worked with RoverDude and other modders, it's not altogether unlikely that that is the case.

> 
> God that would be perfect. However, they've always announced that modders were going to contribute their work well before the next release, that hasn't happened here. I hope you're right, I just don't know though.

I thought the same. But clouds have been this on going shtick ksp has had for so long that as a jest Squad would make an attempt to keep it under wraps. That would be outstanding. 

If not something has to happen. I don't see how Squad can release KSP without clouds at this point. I personally can't play without EVE. Can't do it, won't do it. It looks so plain and void without clouds. Straight up boring.

Well, SQUAD already dabbled around putting clouds in the game around 0.14-0.15 ( if you dig the forums you might even find some in game pics of SQUAD experimental implementation of clouds at the time ... if the big forum mess of some years ago did not ate them, that is ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) ) that was shelved due to #reasons ( mostly performance issues IIRC ). I would not be much surprised if they simply picked that code and Ctrl-C Ctrl-V on 1.0 code, especially since a lot of the issues with performance there were in the time were fixed already ...

> 
> I'm curious what my i7 is trying to do as well. It's like KSP is rendering a planet inside another planet or something, makes no sense.

That's exactly what it's doing with the planets with water. But you probably knew that and were just being snarky.

> 
> That's exactly what it's doing with the planets with water. But you probably knew that and were just being snarky.

You have correctly detected snark in that post.

Well, i guess this will not be the last update to ksp ever, but clouds and more useful water would be another awesome features for 1.0 ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> I'm curious what my i7 is trying to do as well. It's like KSP is rendering a planet inside another planet or something, makes no sense.

It must be a very weird reason, shame i can't remember what version stopped the water lag for me - may be able to see some differences.

> 
> I have this little theory. And I hope... 
> Rbray, the creator of EVE went missing all of sudden right around the time it was announced KSP was going to 1.0. ( might've been sometime before then )

Sadly, it was long enough before 1.0 was announced that there was speculation that he went dark because they were adding clouds to 0.90. I hope along with you but don't expect it.

> 
> It must be a very weird reason, shame i can't remember what version stopped the water lag for me - may be able to see some differences.

Same here. I used to edit the config file every time a new version came out. then suddenly I didn't need to. I wonder why regex is still having the problem.

Also, regex, do you do the config file edit to fix it, or does that no longer work, or do you not know such an edit would help, or... I'm sure there's an option d) but I can't think of it.

> 
> It must be a very weird reason, shame i can't remember what version stopped the water lag for me - may be able to see some differences.

The water has always lagged for me on my Core2 Duo/Radeon 4650, on my i3/Radeon (can't remember the model) laptop, on my i7/Intel HD4600, whether in Linux or Windows, bone stock or modded to hell. Rendering *an entire planet* underneath another *entire planet* is bound to cause problems.
In my experience the water lag issue reduced, but it was never fully cured.

> 
> In my experience the water lag issue reduced, but it was never fully cured.

That is also my experience. It is not that bad as it was, say, in 0.17, but it still delivers some lag compared with dry land.

> 
> Felipe (HarvesteR): ......... In preparation for the impending experimentals phase.........

I thought we were in experimentals stage? Maybe that was a comment from earlier in the week?

> 
> Wow, great progress! Glad to see the tech tree is more transparent now, and I'll be using aircraft much more often now thanks to the parts being available earlier.
> One question, though: is water lag going to be fixed in 1.0?

This is the most pressing issue of our times!

> I thought we were in experimentals stage? Maybe that was a comment from earlier in the week?

Appearance of experimentals on Steamdb reported at 10:16 this morning.

Happy landings!

I see there's a new twitter post:

So, since the 22.5km bubble occurred, will you implement an option that allows for you to modify the bubble to something larger or smaller?

Thanks, I love KSP!

Too small of a bubble for that. Remember, the falcon 9 first stage fully exits the atmosphere on a suborbital trajectory before it comes back. We'd need 70 km minimum for that to work, hopefully it's easily customizable as an "at your own risk" thing.

> 
> I thought we were in experimentals stage? Maybe that was a comment from earlier in the week?

Some players started wondering what private server "experimental" testers were getting builds from, [based on the first announcement](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/114645-Kerbal-Space-Program-1-0-Enters-Experimental-Testing). Now we know, no such thing was happening ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

> Still crossing my fingers for a probes-first tech tree...

+1 

Not that I'm seeing the ( current ) devs breaking their addiction to see Jeb on the first flight of every save, though ...

> 
> It must be a very weird reason, shame i can't remember what version stopped the water lag for me - may be able to see some differences.

It has been a problem on Windows and Linux, on my desktop (Win32, Core2Duo, Radeon 4650), my old laptop (Win32, i3, Radeon something or the other), and my new laptop (Linux x64, i7, Intel HD4600), since I started playing the game seriously around 0.20.

> 
> Also, regex, do you do the config file edit to fix it, or does that no longer work, or do you not know such an edit would help, or... I'm sure there's an option d) but I can't think of it.

It generally helped on my old laptop, but not on the new one. The big problem is that the system is literally rendering an *entire planet* underneath another *entire planet*. Sure, I could set the water subdivisions to 1 at every level but IMO that's a terrible solution to what should be optimized in the game.
I'm happily running a 64 bit client. Of course, it not windows. Linux 64 bit works very well, >100 mods and counting
